metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Second Sunday after Pentecost

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems a humanity that is in a state of 'vast primordial catastrophe' and self-destruction.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the 'miserable offender'

zender.identificatie: The Triune Nature of God (Inner core of being)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out

helper.identificatie: The Grace of Christ / The Holy Spirit / Human 'glimmers' of love
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son
That person has conveyed to you a measure of the love of God

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as Cosmic Power / Self-Destruction / Resistance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as petty rule-breaking but as a catastrophic estrangement and an ontological 'lack of health'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and 'fear of the Lord' as an entrance into the larger life of God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Psalmist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (confession) is explicitly framed as a result of being 'about to be saved' by the Primary Subject (God).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Triune Love → Redemption → The Miserable Offender

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave.
The love of God bears all things.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The psalmist ceases to reflect upon himself.
You would spend huge amounts of money.

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
you would do anything, anything at all
if we can only begin to understand what is meant here
total inability to present ourselves righteous

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by God's 'pouvoir-faire' (sovereign power to save).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (The Depths) to ~S2 (Honest confession of no health) to S1 (Forgiveness/Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's nature as 'self-giving love' which bridges the gap that human merit cannot.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'vast primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation and defines the human condition as one of total inability, requiring an external rescue.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The God who pursues us even beyond the grave

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human figures (parents, Paul) are used as 'glimmers' or analogies of God's action, not as models for the hearer to imitate to earn favor.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Paul (as an analogy of God's agony)
The Psalmist (as a model of honesty, not merit)

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'renewed confidence' through external rescue.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The secondary program of ethics/response is perfectly subordinated to the primary program of God's grace.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: redeem his entire creation from its impulse toward self-destruction

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative structure. God is the Subject, Grace is the Object, and Sin is a formidable Opponent.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The emphasis on human inability is necessary for the 'De Profundis' theme.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The 'miserable offender' language already maximizes the Opponent.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the trap of moralism by grounding human response in the prior and overwhelming action of the Triune God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the parental pathos, Greimasian analysis reveals that the parent is merely a 'Helper' actant pointing to the 'Subject' (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Trinitarian formula; semiotics explains how that formula functions as the 'engine' of the hearer's hope.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'fear of the Lord' is not a Devoir (duty) but a result of the Subject's (God's) Performance of forgiveness.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Rutledge's 'God as Subject' rule with high precision.
